structure.unit: LIQUEFIED PETROLEUM GAS AND OTHER FLAMMABLE LIQUIDS

law.catch_line: Label required on container or apparatus from which sale is made.
law.text: No dealer shall sell or deliver kerosene, coal oil, fuel oil, stove oil, range oil, furnace oil or other Class B liquid except from a container having the name of the liquid sold plainly marked or labeled on the container, or on the pump or delivery equipment serving such container.
law.history: Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 3, effective June 17, 1954.
